meanings.definition: A type of wax used for polishing wood.
meanings.sent1: I bought some woodwax to make my old table shiny.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter applied woodwax to the chair to give it a glossy finish.
meanings.sent3: The woodwax whispered to the wooden shelf, 'I will make you sparkle!'
meanings.sent4: The woodwax danced on the surface of the table, leaving a gleaming trail behind.
meanings.sent5: The woodwax worked its magic, transforming the dull wood into a lustrous masterpiece.

meanings.definition: To apply woodwax to a surface for protection and shine.
meanings.sent1: She carefully woodwaxed the antique dresser to preserve its beauty.
meanings.sent2: Every spring, we woodwax our outdoor furniture to shield it from the elements.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to woodwax the floor, thinking it was a fun game.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, she woodwaxed the windows, making them gleam like diamonds.
meanings.sent5: With skilled hands, he woodwaxed the wooden boat, ensuring it stayed pristine in the water.
